messages.message:
Hey Team, Hi,

I’m trying to use the Scheduler app for scheduling the execution of a flow (for a NatWest requirement to extract model performance on a schedule basis). I’ve raised Jira ticket https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/UI-148, but here is the description of the issue and the requests made for usability enhancement:

> _I’m experiencing some UI issues that needs to be fixed:_
> _1) when selecting the binary, the scheduler modal dialog remains in the foreground, making in impossible to use the file selector modal dialog in the background._
> _2) same for selecting the input folder._
> 
> _Now with the should have feature requirements:_
> _1) my flow is using runtime parameters, there is no field to define these parameters as defined on the Run Flow execution and I think the scheduler app should have one in the option configurations part of the dialog._
> 
> _And finally with the nice to have requirements:_
> _1) It would be nice to be able to schedule a flow on a minute basic (5, 10, 15 ..) for development testing purpose, waiting for 1 hour (lowest time interval level is not convenient)_
> _2) It should be possible to set the time as well as date precisely rather than being stuck with a default option_
I can’t provide the scheduler app as a solution until it is fixed and enhanced.
I guess I can schedule the flow using an external client + Flow APIs, but this is a tactical solution.

Has anybody got a better idea until I can use  the Scheduler App as it is supposed to be used?
Screenshot 2021-07-14 at 17.48.02
Scheduler app is marked as a beta because it doesn’t really have a owner right now. I wasn’t sure it was actually being used by customers.

NatWest require  a flow to be executed on a scheduled basis, the use case is for extracting summary performance data on a weekly basis for BI reporting. So what would be the best solution for this if I can’t use the scheduler app as-is now? A cronjob + external Flow API call? Can’t the Scheduler App be made production worthy?

We haven’t had the bandwidth or resources to prioritize any work for that app. I don’t have a sense of how much work it would be since it doesn’t have any active owner/development on it, and it’s not even included in our UATs afaik.

I understand the constraints and capacity limitations to maintain or develop that app further. Just in case the apps is in scope for UAT activities , the NatWest use case is a genuine business requirement and would be perfect  to test that feature. But in my opinion, the scheduler app should not be  deployed on prem or even IB.com (http://IB.com) when it is in a broken state and unusable.

Hence why I raised the Jira ticket, if the Scheduler App cannot be fixed for the forseeable releases then it should be removed or at least fixed to a minimum viable product version of it.  Either way I need to know what to say to the customer with regards to scheduling with IB, at the moment it is not clear.

Got it! I believe it’s tagged a beta app so it is hidden to all users except the special site admins. The ticket definitely is helpful! If there are some quick UI issues that can be  fixed to enable use, then it can be worth it (fyi<!subteam^SQC4GLFN2> to chime in on that!). The suggestions for improving the time granularity and config options sound like feature improvements that are things we should definitely consider, but dont’ sound like blockers.

Hi all, I agree with @Heymian. We can fix the UI issues but the extra feature requirements would need to be researched a bit more. If the UI issues are fixed without the other feature enhancements, is that enough to solve the problem for NatWest @Seb? Otherwise I recommend going with your back up option for now.

Hi @John St, as a minimum I need the ui fixes and the possibility to specify runtime flow parameters, otherwise I have to use my backup external solution. Regardless, the ui issues should be fixed, it doesn’t reflect well otherwise
Afterthoughts , I can still use the scheduler if the ui issues are fixed, I’ll just provide the runtime parameters from a Json file, but ideally this should be an optional config in the UI. Thanks
Sounds good, thanks for creating the JIRA. I’d prepare your back up solution and I’ll let you know if I’m able to get those UI issues fixed soon. Thanks
The UI issues are already fixed and will be included in the July release (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/20448), but we haven’t added the ability to specify runtime flow parameters yet
to clarify, by runtime parameters, you mean the “Runtime Configs” in this screenshot, right? Would it be helpful to also include the toggles and settings above “Runtime Configs”?

and to follow up on the feasibility of the nice-to-haves, @Kerry would adding a time parameter for when to run the scheduled job be relatively easy? but allowing lower granularity time periods would be tricky?
@Serena I don’t think I follow :smile: i need to play with the scheduler app first i never used it… where do you want to add the “time parameter”, what is it for?

In Scheduler, you can set whether the flow should run hourly, daily, weekly, etc.
• the time parameter would allow the user to set when the flow should run (ex: 10am instead of 12am on a daily schedule)
• lower granularity time periods would allow the user to run the flow every 10 min for example, instead of every hour (which is currently the lowest time interval)
